author: andreas
content:
Leaves. This is MariahilferstraÃŸe, one of the busiest streets in Vienna. When the Underground line U3 was built, the old street car tracks in the middle were replaced by two lanes for cars, and the sidewalks were broadened. On both sides are now trees, some kind of fast growing and resilient acacia, but of course the constant traffic takes its toll. Leaves on some branches are already yellow and falling, while the rest of the trees is still green.

No, this is no indication of early autumn in Austria ğŸ™‚
